text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Norwegian papers this morning:

- Shipbuilding and construction group Kvaerner has sold its fleet of refrigerated carrier ships for one billion crowns to Norwegian shipping company Agdesidens Rederi and the European investment fund Daugthy Hanson & Co.
- Doctors are threatening to boycott the air ambulance service because of poor safety. In the last ten years there have been four helicopter accidents and twelve people have died.
- Art students protested on Wednesday against proposed cuts in education grants. As part of the protest the students gave all the members of parliament a piece of art.
- Umoe Haugesund will probably win the contract to build the semi-submersible platform for Norsk Hydro's Troll C oilfield. The contract is worth about 5.3 billion crowns.

- In a recent report the International Monetary Fund said it feared an overheating of Norwegian economy. The IMF said that a tighter fiscal policy was necessary than that presented by the government in the National Budget for 1997.
